text: 14.109 In designing buildings, active frontages are encouraged in part 1(d) and through policy PS4, as they can provide feelings of safety and sociability through encouraging activity at different times of the day and night. This can assist in making women and other vulnerable users of streets feel safe and able to use streets throughout the day and into the evening and nighttime to create busy, intergenerational, connected places. Building entrances (including subordinate entrances such as back or side doors) should be well-lit and easily visible, avoiding narrow or concealed entranceways.
